#summary PIE Function : Maths Functions

= PIE Function : Maths Functions=

LX10 is capable of doing four types of maths functions:
  * add
  * subtract
  * multiply
  * divide

N.B. PIE language deals with whole numbers only. This means that if the result of a divide requires a decimal place the decimal numbers will simply be cut off. Decimal numbers *do not round up*.


== Example ==


<font color = "blue">make</font> x 

<font color = "blue">set</font> x <font color = "blue">to</font> 1

=== add ===

<font color = "brown">add</font> 9 <font color = "blue">to</font> x <br>
<font color = "green">@ or</font> <br>
<font color = "blue">set</font> x <font color = "blue">to</font> x + 9

=== subtract ===

<font color = "brown">take</font> 9 <font color = "blue">from</font> x <br>
<font color = "green">@ or</font> <br>
<font color = "blue">set</font> x <font color = "blue">to</font> x - 9


=== divide ===

<font color = "blue">set</font> x <font color = "blue">to</font> x / 9

=== multiply ===

<font color = "blue">set</font> x <font color = "blue">to</font> x `*` 9
